node.title: Airlines in U.S., U.K. Increasing Flights as Travel Rules Ease for International Residents
node.description: Flights between the U.S. and U.K. alone are projected to increase 21 percent this month, according to a travel analytics firm.

node.title: Elementary Schools Urged by White House to Set up COVID Vaccine Clinics for Students
node.description: The Food and Drug Administration says the shots are safe and proven to be almost 91 percent effective in preventing COVID-19 in a study of 2,268 children.

node.title: 25 Kids at Afghan Hospital Died of Malnutrition in 2 Months, Staff Working Without Pay
node.description: Afghanistan has seen a huge surge in children's malnutrition cases because of drought and the worsening economic crisis under Taliban rule.

node.title: Railroads Offering Employees $300 to Get Vaccinated as Sides Argue About Federal Mandate
node.description: BNSF railroad filed a lawsuit Sunday against its major unions, joining Norfolk Southern and Union Pacific, both of which filed suits last month.

node.title: Woman Says She Almost Lost Her Leg After Spin Class in Video Viewed 3M Times
node.description: The TikToker suffered from rhabdomyolysis, a condition that has become associated with spin classes and other forms of strenuous exercise.

node.title: Some Pro Sports Teams Nix COVID Vaccinations, Negative Test Requirements For Fans
node.description: The teams include a mix of NHL and NBA clubs from Tennessee to Texas.

node.title: NFL Has a Bizarre Week, and This Week's Games Are Only Just Beginning
node.description: From COVID to injuries, a trade whiff, a fatal car crash and more, this weekend's games couldn't get here fast enough.

node.title: New York City Marathon Set to Return With a Variety of Pandemic-Forced Changes
node.description: The 33,000 runners are expected to be vaccinated or show proof of a negative COVID-19 test within 48 hours.

node.title: NFL, Washington Football Team Should Lift Sexual Harassment Claim NDAs, Congress Says
node.description: More than a year ago, 15 former employees of the Washington Football Team made allegations of sexual harassment within the organization.

node.title: NASCAR Denounces 'Let's Go Brandon' Chant, Will Sue for Use of Slogan With Its Trademarks
node.description: The "Let's Go Brandon" chant originated at a NASCAR race and has been used to criticize President Joe Biden.

node.title: Shalane Flanagan Returns to NYC Marathon 4 Years After Historic Win With New Goal in Sight
node.description: The former NYC Marathon champion will attempt to complete her sixth marathon in six weeks during Sunday's race.

node.title: Terry Bradshaw Rips Aaron Rodgers Over COVID Fiasco: 'You Lied to Everyone'
node.description: "Unfortunately, we've got players that pretty much think only about themselves," the Pittsburgh Steelers legend said.

node.title: Simone Biles Taking Break From Gymnastics to Figure Out 'What I Really Want to Do'
node.description: "For me, it's just finding out what I really want to do," Biles said, adding that she is not sure whether the break will be temporary or permanent.

node.title: Athlete Welfare, Giving More Governing Power to Schools Among NCAA Restructuring Goals
node.description: The new constitution is the first phase of transforming the NCAA to give more power to schools and conferences, instead of the Indianapolis-based association.

node.title: Female Hockey Goalie Who Was Victim of Vulgar Chants From Students Returns to Ice
node.description: 50 to 60 students have been identified and punished for the incident, which occurred in Pennsylvania.

node.title: Oscar Pistorius Required to Meet With Victim's Parents to Be Considered for Parole
node.description: The South African Olympian fatally shot his girlfriend, Reva Steenkamp, on Valentine's Day 2013 and was convicted of murder in 2015.

node.title: College Sports Paid Over $500M in 'Dead Money' to Fired Coaches Over Last Decade
node.description: Auburn, Nebraska, Texas, Ole Miss and Kansas were among the schools that paid coaches at least $20 million to not coach.

node.title: State Farm Cuts Back on Aaron Rodgers' Ads, Still Stands With QB Amid Vaccine Comments
node.description: Less than 2 percent of State Farm advertisements featured Rodgers on Sunday, down significantly from 25 percent one week earlier.

node.title: Washington Benches Head Coach As 'No Tolerance' Response to Sideline Skirmish With Player
node.description: Washington head coach Jimmy Lake was suspended from team activities for the week and Saturday's game against Arizona State after pushing player Ruperake Fuavai.

node.title: NBA Champion Bucks Visit Biden's White House, Ending Drought From the Trump Era
node.description: President Joe Biden welcomed the champions into the White House, the first team in nearly five years.
